topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d030416368721ce60a0000#post_53d030416368721ce60a0000
[bq="Whatevs"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d02e5a6368720e24d0100#post_53d02e5a6368720ec24d0100
Thank god[/bq]
Now if only they would come out with a fucking stable operating system for once.  If you're wondering what I mean by this is that the reason why windows has so many viruses and such is that the security for it is about as waterproof as a sponge.

Personally that's what I think they should focus on with Windows 9 is solely bug fixing, working on performance and closing as many security holes as they can find.  You're obviously never going to get a operating system perfect, but working on making windows a secure operating system and work on increasing performance would definitely be a started.

If you're wondering why windows runs so slowly versus linux is that windows is a graphically based operating system and thus a heavy resource hog.  Linux on the other hand can run on as little as 70mb ram.  The current "desktop environment" I'm using only uses 100mb and has all the bells and whistles.  The problem Windows has is that they're all about making it look flashy than making it fast or stable.  The problem with linux is that it's not user friendly.  The problem with mac is overpriced.

topics.body:
"@QueenCold":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d03ac96368726c51940000#post_53d03ac96368726c51940000

Okay so I'm going out on a limb and guessing that maybe giving them tanks, guns, and aircraft is a bad idea? 

"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-threa/post/53d03b04636872689a830000#post_53d03b04636872689a830000

Uh, well that's relative, and also nukes like that have certain measures to ensure detonation, like timers. But back to the point, the world in which magic exists can be relative, there's no set law to how much a unicorn can lift with magic and also the amount of power required to lift things can be limited. We have no idea, I'm running this on a guess that there's a set limit for all unicorns.

So yeah, giving ponies WWII level of weaponry and technology is probably a very bad idea right? 
Because I wanted to make Shining Armor into a marine and send him off to fight in Germaney, or send him off to battle some Griffons, or Lions. I got a picture commission coming up for a fanfic where humans go off to Equestria and help them modernize.

topics.body:
The modernization of Equestria is going to be interesting, because of the sheer amount of consequences to helping a peaceful nation militarize and industrialize to its great capacity, and of course because America will be doing it and who would question the Americans about modernization, they've done a great job, right? Right?

Oh well, how quickly things turn to utter hell is dependent on how many want to switch over from a monarchy to a democracy, though I can imagine a political uprising won't happen, a social revolution might. I can see Celestia giving up power to let Equestria run itself.
topics.author: 5046d66d7f123b38980018c6

topics.body:
"@Evident Disaster":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d03d156368726b7ad60000#post_53d03d156368726b7ad60000
Okay; I'm going to have stop this debate for a second in that this discussion is heavily relying on overused science fiction tropes.

If Equestria was real then in all probability the cultural shock would be only a couple years long.  Also in all probability magic would be a massive boost to our how advanced we are in much the same way that technology would be a massive boost to them.  "Magic" is just a terminology used for things we don't understand.  Things like Tigers and Pandas were once thought to be mythical creatures and that forces like the electromagnetic force was once thought to be a miracle and so forth.

The most likely long term change would be technological esoterism in that machines that mimic the way this "magic" would be created in much the same way that the once mystical force of electricity is now utilized by machines in ways that no one could possibly think was possible.

If "magic" and such was real it would just be another force in the universe that we didn't know about before in much the same way gravity was once considered magic.

If "magic" was real I would be the person running "spells" on my phone instead of a magic wand.  Why spend decades learning spells when you can just make a machine to simulate how they work and run it for you and mass produce them?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:

I was trying to approach this in an objective kind of view, where Equestria existed in another reality, and mankind sent along a bunch of explorers, and provided them with a whole new culture.
